name: Fullstack Javascript Developer | React/Node.js
description:

Today, we are a growing SaaS start-up with a rapid subscriber user base from around the world including Australia, NZ, Canada, and the United States.

The Position:

You'll be part of an agile and effective team as you build the product and integrate it into a disruptive SaaS application.

What technical skills will you need to succeed in this role?

  • 2+ years of Full Stack Development experience, using ReactJS/Redux/Hooks and Node.js/Express/Typescript
  • Solid experience with JavaScript, ES6, HTML5, CSS3 and responsive application design
  • Cross-browser, cross-platform, cross-device compatibility issues and ways to work around them
  • Rapidly prototype web applications to showcase new concepts and ideas
  • Suggests new technologies and approaches
  • Estimate the duration and level of effort of development tasks
  • Experience working with Agile methodologies
  • Understand modern development practices (CI/CD, Cloud, etc.)
  • Excellent problem-solving skills
  • Ability to meet deadlines, and work independently and within a team, with clear reporting and focused on results

Desirable Experience:

Interactive map libraries such as Leaflet.js, GIS data handling (GeoJSON, shapefiles, etc.) and AWS

name: Full stack engineer
description:
There are a lot of things we think are great about working at Linktree but we are biased, so here are the answers to the things we get asked most by Engineers when we are hiring at Linktree:

What is your tech stack?
The below doesn't mean we expect everyone to have all of the below, our primary languages are react, node.js with some legacy PHP so that is great to have as a starting point.
The rest of our stack includes React, Node.js, Typescript, Storybook, Elasticsearch, REST APIs, PostgreSQL, GraphQL, AWS (Lambda), Kubernetes, Terraform and Snowflake. Our first build was in PHP so that is in our legacy code but React/Node is where the stack is headed.

What do you look for in engineers?

Great problem solvers who enjoy collaborating with others (not just engineers) that value well written and tested code. A match with our current tech stack and the ongoing desire to continue to learn new skills and share yours with others. Experience in similar startup environments can be good as you are used to this style of working but we care more about you and your skills over what names are on your CV.

Where is this role based?

We are mostly based in Melbourne but currently have engineers in Perth, Tasmania, Newcastle, Queensland, country Victoria, and Ireland. Our CTO Mitch Malone is also fully remote so you could be anywhere really. We are still all working from home due to COVID but plan on being a mixed remote and on-site company beyond that.

What is your dev environment like?
Linktree has grown a lot and quite quickly, which means our structures and processes aren't perfect, yet. That should be ok with you and if anything, appeal to you so you can contribute to the design of those systems.
We are agile with one of our Lead Engineers also an agile coach and cross-functional. We don't have BA's or have any intention of hiring in the near future, as we expect our Engineers to do requirements analysis and work closely with Product Managers and Designers on developing user stories. Our Engineering team writes unit, integration and e2e tests and we have a DevOps specialist building out DevOps practices.

What is your company culture like?

Linktree's company culture and values are based around collaboration, diversity, inclusion, and flexibility. Those are all nice words but to give you some more specific examples:


  • We are family-friendly and flexible work environment with our team with a number of our team working hours around school and home commitments
  • We have several diversity and inclusion initiatives underway, including a D&I council, training for all staff on neurodiversity and the incorporation of a transgender inclusion policy
  • Our team is diverse across age, gender, and race and we love that
  • Due to COVID we are all remote but even when COVID is behind us, we will be a mixed remote and in-office company. With our team already spread across 8 locations and 3 countries, we will always be some form of remote.
  • All employees have free access to https://www.smilingmind.com.au/ & https://uprise.co/, including 1:1 coaching sessions from qualified psychologists or counselors.

    We have grown quickly in 2020, from 20 people to 40 in the past 6 months, and have more growth planned due to the continued expansion of our customer base around the world.

The Linktree story…


The Linktree journey begins in 2016, when co-founders Alex, Anthony and Nick were running a digital agency and using Instagram to make announcements about the artists they managed. Created as a side hustle to solve a simple problem, Linktree has well outgrown its roots, with over 7 million users worldwide, 20,000 + new signups every day, and over 120 million unique views per month. Paired with rapid growth, Linktree has recently garnered much attention in the tech world, earning 4th place on Fast Company's "10 most innovative social media companies of 2020".


The Linktree audience is broad, spanning publications, artists, celebrities, fashion and beauty influencers, YouTube stars, sports teams and household brands, right the way through to individuals with a side hustle and micro-influencers. Linktree subscribers include Alicia Keys, Selena Gomez, Pharrell, Jamie Oliver, Vice, Red Bull, Adult Swim, Patreon, Naomi Campbell, Comedy Central, Gordon Ramsay, Billabong…and many more!


If you're still reading this and feel like you're a match for us, please send your details through via the apply button or to mitch@linktr.ee

  • Exceptional organisational skills and attention detail with the ability to work efficiently to meet deadlines
Benefits and Culture
We offer a friendly, welcoming team environment where continued support, training and generous employee benefits are provided, including discount across all brands and subsidised personal training sessions. As a privately owned company we thrive on building great relationships with our team and our customers. We work to make things happen and when a job is done, big or small we celebrate!
This is an exciting opportunity to join Munro Footwear Group as we continue to grow! If this sounds like you then join us by applying now!

name: Node JS web developer
description:
Our Company

We are a new startup business that is looking to create a new online marketplace that never existed before.

The Role

We are looking for a passionate, experienced NodeJS web developer to join our team to build an eCommerce online marketplace website. This position is for 6 months with option to extend to a permanent full-time position.

You will be joining our main developer to build the site based on existing HTML design.

You must have 2+ years of experience NodeJS, Javascript, React, either through projects, or freelancing work that you’ve done, or through past work experience.

You must have great passion for coding, web development, a team player with excellent communication skills.

You will need to demonstrate your experience and skills by showcasing your portfolio of previous sites that you have built, explaining and showing what tools you used to build the sites..

You will contribute to building both front and back end of the site, including creating SQL databases.

It is an advantage if you are familiar with Amazon AWS hosting, server-less application, and have experience with integrating websites with Stripe payment gateway.

Only candidates who are Australian permanent resident or citizen will be considered.

The site

Is an online marketplace for users to hire items from each other. Users can sign up for an account and log in; Search, find, read reviews, check other user profile, send messages to other users, and hire listed item from another user. The user can list multiple items for hire (available on which day and from the time it is available on each day). User can hire the listed item and select the days and time that he wants to hire. When the item is hired, our platform will process payment through Stripe payment gateway.

Part-time hours: 20-30 per week

Expected Start Date: 12/10/2020

Job Types: Part-time, Temporary, Permanent

Salary: $30.00 – $35.00 per hour

Experience:

  • Node JS web developer: 2 years (Preferred)
  • javascript: 2 years (Preferred)

  • Permitted to work permanently with no restriction on hours (e.g. citizen, permanent resident) (Required)

name: Product Designer - Global/Remote
description:
We’re looking for a Product Designer to work on Lagoon, alongside the Product Lead, engineering teams, and end users to take our user experience to the next level! Lagoon is our open source web hosting platform, and currently has a user-facing web-based interface built in React, and a developer-focussed CLI tool built in Go with Cobra, both of which communicate with the Lagoon API via GraphQL.

In the coming months we’re looking to make key improvements to both, as well as developing a fully featured user interface for platform owners and administrators. If you have strong existing design experience in a collaborative environment, maybe as a plus some additional experience with UX/UI design and development, and want to help steer our products forward, then this role could be a fit!


amazee.io is a global Managed Service Provider, specialising in high-performance, flexible, enterprise-grade container hosting solutions built for speed, security, and scalability, with a fully remote, worldwide team. We empower large scale organizations with better deployment processes, the freedom of local development, a flexible container-based hosting platform that can be located anywhere in the world, and 24/7 white-glove support and services.


Our container hosting is built on Lagoon, the open-source build and deploy platform for Kubernetes that amazee.io has been developing since 2017. Lagoon provides projects with all the Kubernetes configuration, tooling and insights needed to run in production at scale, securely.


What you’ll be doing:

  • Working with our internal teams, external partners, and users, identifying opportunities to improve the Lagoon product suite
  • Producing sketches and prototypes to test functionality and formalize design requirements
  • Working closely with developers to further improve the look and feel of our products, ensuring a high level of quality and usability
  • Undertaking research and analysis activities into our user, industry, and market trends to keep us at the forefront of what we do
  • Shaping a culture of design at amazee.io, defining the interactions users have at all levels with our products and tools.
  • ….and if you’re the kind of person who already does UI development or builds prototypes in React (or Vue.js), or wants to super-skill yourself, as we’re a small team, this is a great opportunity to use your cross-skills/develop more.

What you’ll bring:

  • Demonstrated work experience as a digital Product Designer or similar role, looking to take the next step in your career.
  • Experience in digital interface design for web/admin interfaces (and maybe even CLI!)
  • Experience with design programs (Inkscape, Illustrator and Sketch) and prototyping tools (Invision, Figma etc)
  • Strong focus on customer and user advocacy
  • Exceptional verbal and written communication skills in English
  • Excellent eye for aesthetic design and customer appeal
  • Bonus points for experience as a front-end developer, working with React or Vue.js

What we’ll bring:

  • Work in a globally distributed team of creative professionals in a flat international organization
  • Tackle projects with a large multinational customers
  • Opportunity to help build a first-class open-source hosting environment
  • Competitive compensation
  • Flexible work hours/locations
  • 40-hour working week / 5 weeks of vacation
  • Biennial soft and hardware budget
  • Attend conferences and workshops to extend your knowledge
  • Annual education and fitness budgets for your development and wellbeing

Work location:

  • Location is not important. This is a remote position, although we have a preference for a US, Australia/NZ, or European time zone for your working hours.

So what’s next?:

If you’re excited about the opportunity to join an international open source company at the forefront of container-based hosting, and think you might be a good fit then we would love to hear from you!


Send us your CV and cover letter showcasing who you are, your technical knowledge, and anything else you think we should know!


The amazee.io Team.

Job Title: Full Stack Developer
Department: Conformity
Location: Sydney, Australia
Travel Required: N/A
Reporting To: Engineering Manager
Direct Report: N/A
Position Type: Permanent - Full Time
Level: Mid

Job Description
Are you a passionate and solution driven developer looking to accelerate your career into a fast growing technology sector? Conformity is a leading product in continuous security and governance assurance for AWS and Azure cloud infrastructure, and its global user base is rapidly expanding. We are looking for a Full Stack Developer to join our team in Sydney, Australia.

We offer a competitive salary, support from a talented global team, great benefits, and a high-energy environment with lots of room for personal and professional growth.

Responsibilities

  • Engineering ownership of product modules, components, and services.
  • Lead engineering design and implementation to deliver new innovations and solutions for our customers.
  • Maintain existing codebase and create new front and back end modules, components, and services.
  • Manage, deploy and maintain well orchestrated packages across several different environments so we can ship new code to production on a weekly basis.
  • Remain current with market developments and recommend new technologies.
  • Increase the quality of our code, and enhance development pipelines.
  • Work with developers, designers, QA, and product managers to improve the end to end product development process.


About you
You have a keen interest in building scalable and maintainable code to solve problems faced by businesses and its employees. You have a highly analytical mind that critically evaluates problems and solutions, as well as tools and technologies to assist in delivering product goals expediently and cost effectively. You are comfortable working independently and within a team, and seek to foster a culture of inclusion and constructive communication.

You must be legally entitled to work in Australia to apply for this position.

Key skills and experience:

  • 3 to 4 years experience in full-stack, test driven application development on Node.js.
  • HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Node.js and AJAX.
  • Experienced with React, but Ember.js / AngularJS / Vue.js experience is accepted.
  • A solid understanding of the “path to production” process i.e. build and deployment, with experience using CI/CD tooling e.g. CodePipeline / Jenkins / BuildKite / Bamboo, etc.
  • Github or Git.
  • Demonstrated ability for clear and frequent communication with local and remote teams.
  • Write clear, legible, secure and optimised code.
  • Confident in taking on a broad set of responsibilities including managing, deploying and maintaining well orchestrated services across several different environments.
  • Comfortable analysing business requirements.
  • Comfortable handling bugs and/or customer support.
  • Experience with estimating development efforts.
  • Nice to have experience
    • Working in an AWS environment
    • OOP (e.g. Java / C#)
    • Strongly-typed languages (e.g. Typescript / Flow)
    • Working at a startup
    • Ember.js (we are transitioning out of Ember)


Personal qualities

  • You strive for open and honest communication with respect for others.
  • Professional demeanour and a desire to exceed expectations.
  • Desire to learn about new platforms, technologies, be adaptable and share what you learn with your team.
  • You have rational opinions and you are able to make compromises.
  • You like getting things done and care about how they get done.
  • You are proactive and self-directed, identifying issues and opportunities ahead of time.
  • You strive for achievement and make a difference.


About us
Cloud One - Conformity is a market-leading software platform helping companies & IT professionals who have invested in the cloud to continuously monitor their AWS (Amazon Web Services) and Azure cloud infrastructure. The platform focuses on all major elements of advanced security, real-time threat detection, cost optimisation, best practices, compliance and automation of the environment.

We are constantly innovating our processes, technology stack, and our product, and are keen to hear about new ideas or technologies that will make Cloud One - Conformity a better working environment.

All of our codebase and system have gone through several iterations, and have ultimately been built by a small team of passionate engineers using serverless technologies and a microservices architecture.

Our stack is made of 50+ different services across three regions. We use a range of serverless AWS services to make it all work such as Lambda, StepFunctions, DynamoDB, Elasticsearch, KMS, SNS to name a few. To help us manage all those services, we have chosen the Serverless framework. We have interwoven Development and DevOps teams and we believe conforming to infrastructure and security best practices is a shared responsibility.

All our client-server communication is based on the JSON:API standard. The code we produce is built using CodeBuild and a homemade CICD pipeline that is specifically designed for our needs. For the front end, we currently use Ember.js, but are in the process of migrating to React frontend microservices.

We strive to create the best possible product and believe that diversity at all levels is an enabler of that. No matter your gender, race, ethnicity or sexuality, we encourage everyone to be their authentic selves in order to foster a culture of belonging.

We believe in hiring tomorrow’s leaders and empowering them today. We promote a healthy work life balance which includes a flexible work from home policy. We'll never ask an employee to work weekends or late nights, and pride ourselves in being understanding and considerate of employee needs. If that’s the environment that you’re looking for, then look no further!

Benefits
Salary $80,000 - $130,000 + super
On the job training and mentoring
Weekly team events including breakfast Mondays, pizza Fridays, and social events ﻿
Funding for continued education and training
Flexible and relaxed working environment
Ownership driven model of responsibility and individual empowerment
Path to a senior full stack developer role

So...what happens next?
Once we've received your application we'll give it the attention it deserves and you'll hear from us either way. If you have the right experience, a member of our team will give you a call (so make sure you keep your phone handy!) and from there we'll support you through the interview process which may include a short assignment before a face to face interview.

name: Software Engineer
description:
Information Technology Services (ITS)

The Division of Information Technology Services (ITS) at The University of Queensland provides an information environment that supports the teaching, learning, research and engagement objectives of the University and contributes positively to the student experience and the University’s reputation. It delivers network, systems and IT infrastructure support to the University, and enhances UQ’s capabilities through the deployment of new infrastructure, systems and application development.

The largest central division within UQ and one of the largest employers of IT professionals in Queensland, UQ’s ITS Division has both breadth and depth across all aspects of technology. ITS supports the University with many exciting technologies; artificial intelligence, robotics, IoT, cloud, high performance computing, data analytics, virtual networks, high speed networks and big data are just some of the technologies that are being deployed to support UQ’s dynamic environment and varied stakeholders.

Also located within ITS is the internationally recognised network security group, AusCERT, which provides Internet security services throughout Australia and New Zealand. ITS manages core networks not only for the whole of The University of Queensland but also works with other Queensland universities by managing access to the national university network (AARNet). ITS also operates research computing infrastructure and hosts many of the University’s largest servers.

About This Opportunity

This is an excellent position for a Software Engineer to provide a high level of development and support for computing and network installations in ITS, client departments and organisations. This role is very fitting for someone who has strong interpersonal skills as this role will be a major link between ITS and the client.

This position is located at our Toowong office location on High street, just minutes from the CBD & walking distance from public transport.

Our Ideal Candidate

  • Qualifications and training equivalent to an undergraduate degree in IT or related field and significant relevant experience; or an equivalent combination of relevant experience and/or education/training.
  • Skills and experience in analysis, design, development, systems management and maintenance of multi-user systems or applications.
  • Detailed knowledge in the following areas, with significant experience in:
  • 5 + years’ experience in programming with NodeJS and PHP
  • Frontend JS frameworks e.g. React, Angular or Ember.
  • Strong knowledge of PHP web frameworks such as Symfony or Laravel.
  • Database development (relational and NoSQL)
  • Docker, Amazon Web Services and Git.
  • Knowledge of Agile software development methods, especially Kanban
  • Self-motivated and keen to learn new technologies based on UQ’s technical landscape
  • Ability to work under tight timelines and on multiple concurrent initiatives, and prioritise work based on urgency

You must have ongoing unrestricted work rights in Australia to apply for this opportunity.

We value diversity and inclusion, and actively encourage applications from those who bring diversity to the University. Our Diversity and Inclusion webpage contains further information if you require additional support. Accessibility requirements and/or adjustments can be directed to recruitment@uq.edu.au.

What We Can Offer

This is a Full-time fixed term position for 24 months at Hew Level 6.

The full-time base salary will be in the range $79,200.25 - $85,067.08, plus super of up to 17%. The total package will be in the range of $92,664.29 – $99,528.48

You will be able to take advantage of UQ Sport Facilities, recreation leave loading (of 17.5%), salary sacrificing options, on-campus childcare, discounted private health insurance, cheap parking, development programs and many other benefits.

For further information, please review The University of Queensland's Enterprise Bargaining Agreement 2018-2021.


Questions?

To discuss this role please contact Sonal Darbari: s.darbari@uq.edu.au

For application queries, please contact recruitment@uq.edu.au stating the job number in the subject line.

name: Software Engineer
description:
Coviu Global is an Australian based startup leading the way in telehealth. We are pioneering a revolutionary way to ensure top quality healthcare across the world regardless of location. We do this by providing a Web-b platform for medical professionals and patients that makes conducting online consultations a breeze and augments the experience with relevant clinical tools and medical workflows. You will be joining an upbeat and dynamic team who enjoy taking on challenges, solving problems, and ensuring the best possible customer experience.

As a company, we spun out from our roots with CSIRO in 2018 with investment from Main Sequence Ventures. We’ve since expanded massively and have now conducted 1.7 million consultations with clinicians across different sized health care businesses, from sole traders and small practices, to large hospitals and government health agencies.

We are now looking for a mid level full-stack engineer to join us as a Platform Engineer in the new and growing Partnership team. The Partnership team is building out a developer ecosystem, for third parties to develop applications on top of Coviu.

You'll be responsible for

  • Building the core functionality of Coviu’s rapidly growing developer platform and “app store”
  • Increasingly automate the process for partners to build applications, submit code, and launch on Coviu
  • Improve the architecture of our platform, to enable increasing levels of self-service
  • Creat, improve and document APIs so partners can spend more time building and launching

Team culture

  • We unblock and enable our staff trusting with loads of autonomy to create and deliver
  • Our culture suits people happy finding answers on their own accord, and creating solutions where they don’t yet exist
  • Coviu suits those who see gaps as opportunities to create something new, not as intimidating or frustrating insufficiencies
  • You’ll be joining our new and growing Partnership team, who start each day with a quick video standup over coffee

Must-have skills

  • Bachelor’s Degree in software engineering or equivalent practical experience
  • 3 years of experience as a software engineer, developer, or equivalent technical experience
  • Experience of a full-stack engineer delivering production-ready systems using modern technologies
  • React.js, Typescript & other frontend frameworks and tools
  • Node.js and other language for backend development
  • Familiarity with Agile practices, especially Scrum and Sprint software lifecycles
  • Proven debugging and troubleshooting skills
  • Excellent communication skills and the ability to contribute as part of a team
  • A demonstrated love of clean, maintainable code

Ideal candidate

  • Familiarity with Cloud services such as AWS
  • Microservices & serverless architecture experience
  • Familiarity with continuous integration and delivery (CICD) & test-driven development (TDD)
  • Docker and related tools
  • Sound security understanding, and the ability to know when to pause and escalate
  • Understanding of SOLID principles

Why work with us

  • Coviu’s ecosystem approach is a key differentiator, and you’ll help make that advantage even stronger
  • An opportunity to work for a growing telehealth software company with exponential growth through the COVID19 crisis
  • Shape the future of a product in a growing start-up with international ambitions
  • Flexible working situation: We are currently remote with an intention to remain blended between working from home and flexible office working hours
  • Excellent company culture based on teamwork and open communication

Salary: $100,000.00 – $120,000.00 per year

Work Remotely:

You should be a beacon of inclusion, teaching/mentoring and uplifting our software development capability to exceed industry standard, ensuring that NAB is seen as an engineering leader whilst finding ways to reduce our cost whilst increasing delivery.


Your Skills and Experience

  • Great fundamental knowledge and experience in HTML, CSS, JavaScript in both the front-end and server environment
  • 3+ years of experience building rich web applications using modern JavaScript build frameworks and tooling, e.g. Typescript, Webpack, npm, yarn

  • Git for version control, branching and merging practices
  • Understanding of how to build performant, testable and maintainable code
  • Enjoy learning, sharing and mentoring with teammates and working collaboratively to provide the best service to our stakeholders
  • Most importantly, an enthusiastic attitude, curiosity for new and emerging technologies and willingness to adapt to circumstances and learn new things

NAB, invested in you

At NAB, we believe success comes from our people. We're committed to supporting your talent and skills through your career, as you help us build a culture that affects change for our customers - and for the community too.


We offer:

  • Fast paced environment, with leading edge technology and innovation
  • Work in a collaborative environment with highly talented and motivated colleagues that are passionate about knowledge sharing

This is an exciting opportunity to join a growing sector of the banking industry with many new applications and projects on the horizon.

To be eligible to apply, you must have Australian or New Zealand citizenship or permanent residency status.

name: Software Engineer
description:
Company Description

About Nine

Nine’s strategy is to create great content, distribute it broadly and engage audiences and advertisers.

We are Australia’s largest locally owned media company – the home of Australia’s most trusted and loved brands spanning News, Sport, Lifestyle, and Entertainment, we pride ourselves on creating the best content, accessed by consumers when and how they want. Nine’s assets include the Nine Network, major mastheads such as The Sydney Morning Herald, The Age and The Australian Financial Review, radio stations 2GB, 2UE, 3AW, MAGIC, 4BC, 4BH and 6PR, digital properties such as nine.com.au, 9Now, 9Honey, Pedestrian.TV, subscription video platform Stan and majority investments in Domain Group and CarAdvice.


Job Description

The Video Technology Team at Nine Digital are a high-performing group of developers, designers, and product managers building the next generation of online TV in Australia. Our users are passionate about TV, and we’re passionate about creating new ways for them to connect and engage with their favourite Channel Nine shows.

The Mobile Apps Team is an agile software development team with the core responsibility of building out Nine’s applications for Android and iOS mobiles. We are highly collaborative and open with a strong focus on mentorship, innovation and inclusivity.

Reporting to the 9Now Web and Apps Engineer Manager, you will collaborate with other software engineers and cross-functional teams to plan, design, develop and test Mobile solutions. Our technology stack is predominantly React Native but you should be willing to deep dive into other areas including Swift and Kotlin.


Qualifications
  • Computer Science degree or equivalent experience.
  • Advanced technical knowledge of JavaScript frameworks, React.js and TypeScript.
  • Strong grasp of OO/functional design, refactoring and similar techniques to create modular, testable and maintainable solutions.
  • Understanding of service-oriented architecture and RESTful web services.
  • Sound knowledge of defensive coding practices to address common security vulnerabilities.
  • Understanding of working in agile environments such as Scrum or Kanban.
  • Experience with Test Driven Development (TDD).
  • Experience with Continuous Integration (CI) and test automation.

Desirable experience and skills

  • React Native
  • Android and iOS development (Swift or Kotlin)

Behaviours

  • Passionate about simplicity. Understating that a developer's job is to provide solutions to problems, not writing code
  • Understanding that there is no “Right Way” to build software, and that the only way to build good software is by adapting theory to fit the needs of the client, codebase, team, tools, and organisation
  • Strong problem-solving ability to identify and address ‘root cause’ for systemic or regularly recurring issues
  • Regularly seeking input from others within the team, respecting opinions and different perspectives
  • Strong communication skills, able to present with confidence in front of technical and non-technical audiences
  • Displaying a commitment to quality and a thorough approach to the work
  • Appreciation for business objectives of a product/project

Additional Information

Nine embraces all aspects of diversity & inclusion and is committed to creating a workplace that reflects the diversity of customers, audiences and communities we serve.

name: Design Systems Lead
description:
Here at Go1, we are committed to providing the best learning opportunities to improve lives through education and training.
The Go1 Content Hub is the largest curated eLearning library from the world’s top training providers, available for a single subscription within an existing learning platform, or available on ours.
We are proud of our team culture where everyone can contribute, have a positive impact and be part of the Go1 journey.
We celebrate each other’s wins and support one another so we can grow as individuals, as teams and as an organisation.

We are currently looking for an experienced, enthusiastic and outgoing Design Systems Lead to join our Architecture team.

In this role, you’ll own the creation and on-going governance of our design system. You will develop our design system in collaboration with our design and engineering team, and establish the framework for design system documentation. You’ll be a subject matter expert to designers, engineers and product managers for all things related to the design system.

Your main responsibilities

  • Collaboratively define the core elements of the Go1 Design System (Go1d), specifying principles, foundations, components, and patterns. As well as documenting behaviours and usage guidelines.
  • Cultivate internal knowledge around the design system by serving as a subject matter expert to contributing teams who may contribute to the design system
  • Use collaborative leadership skills to facilitate the adoption of the design system and ensure the best outcome for stakeholders
  • Own the design system’s development roadmap working closely with our Design, Engineering, and Product teams to identify and prioritize features and requirements
  • Introduce, maintain, and advance front-end and design tools and processes that enable repeatable and scalable success

Your strengths

A successful applicant must have the following:
  • A degree in a relevant field, or equivalent professional experience.
  • 3+ years of experience of UX design for digital products
  • 3+ years of experience designing and/or developing products using a design system
  • 1+ years of experience overseeing the development or maintenance of a design system
  • Deep knowledge of design principles and methods, with extensive experience in most skill areas, tools, and the UX Lifecycle.

A successful applicant should have advanced or better skills in most of the following:
  • Javascript, Typescript, NodeJS
  • CSS & HTML (Recent specifications)
  • React and React-based component libraries
  • CSS-in-JS (e.g. Emotion)
  • Modern accessibility standards
  • Performance optimisation
  • Webpack
  • Figma or equivalent design tool

A successful applicant might have skills in the following
  • Storybook or related system documentation tooling
  • React Native, Expo, Expo for Web
  • Next.js
  • Continuous integration and delivery

Why you will love working with us
  • We love what we do, and we work hard but we’re also flexible and have fun in the process
  • We work as a team – we are open to new ideas, resolve issues together and continue to learn from each other
  • Enjoy unlimited access to the Go1 Content Hub - thousands of training courses are waiting for you!
  • Go1 is on a stable and rapid-growth curve and you will have the opportunity to grow with us

name: Senior Node.JS Developer Brisbane | Permanent - Full time
description:
We're exclusively hiring for Coviu, a fast growth and well-funded start-up who provide a global telehealth platform, allowing doctors to run their practices whilst consulting seamlessly and securely with patients online. They have been steadily growing, however the Covid 19 outbreak has seen them grow rapidly from hundreds of customers per week signing up, to now thousands. At the current customer growth rate, they expect to have 50,000 customers using their product in the coming weeks.

We are looking for a superstar who can cope with the significant high demands of this rapidly growing business and help them approach best practices and implement solutions fast to help scale their platform.

Coviu was first created within the Australian research organisation CSIRO as part of research into telehealth delivery platforms. Working closely with clinicians, they found that existing consumer video calling software and corporate video conferencing applications were not appropriate for healthcare services. Not only did they not satisfy the stringent security and privacy requirements of healthcare businesses, but they missed important business functions such as collecting payments, making appointment bookings, and gathering patient consent.

The Tech:

As a full stack developer, you'll be working across the front-end and back-end software stack, with a focus on back-end.

The back-end is Node.js primarily, with some servers using Scala and Haskell. They follow a micro services architecture since the backend services that power video consultations scale in a diverse manner. Everything is built around APIs. The local development environment is spun up using Docker images to allow you full control. They follow a continuous integration and continuous delivery approach with a vast automated test suite and an automated deployment pipeline into AWS. You'll be working across most of the Coviu platform components, including their WebRTC based video conferencing solution, third party integrations, and their internal and external applications.

Coviu's client facing web application is built with a particular focus on a top notch user experience. Built on the React and Mercury frameworks, they follow modern responsive design principles. Mobile apps are build using react-native.

You'll also be helping to build Coviu's engineering culture by identifying and communicating best practices, and participating in code reviews.

What we're looking for:

As Coviu's stack is heavily based on Javascript technologies, you will have:

  • Experience as a full stack engineer delivering production ready systems using modern Javascript
  • A deep understanding of software engineering fundamentals
  • Proven debugging and troubleshooting skills
  • Excellent communication skills and the ability to contribute as part of a team
  • A love of clean, maintainable code
  • Be able to build simple, elegant solutions that strike the balance between perfection and shipping things quickly.

They are looking for engineers who love to learn and are keen to get stuck in, while taking

responsibility for delivering a quality product.

This opportunity is an excellent opportunity for an outstanding Senior Developer/Lead developer to join one of Australia's leading telehealth platforms, and apply your skills to make a real difference. You will be making a huge contribution and helping the greater community by making these consults more accessible.

You will contribute to the growth and development of this business. Please contact Bharti on 07 3003 7643 quoting reference number #202466 for more information, or click the link to apply!

name: Front-end Web Developer
description:
Guerrilla is a full-service digital, design and communications agency based on the Gold Coast. With over 20 years’ experience, we create exceptional experiences that guide our clients to success. In fact, our work has helped global brands, international organisations and local, game-changing businesses to go out into the world and fulfil their destiny.

Are you ready to fulfil yours?

We’re looking for a full-time front-end web developer with at least 6 years’ experience. You’re highly-skilled in HTML, CSS, and Javascript. While not essential, good PHP knowledge would also be an asset. As we’re often building custom solutions for our clients, your advanced capabilities like custom JS, React or Canvas will be put to good use.

An admirer of clean and efficient code, you’ll fit right into our multi-disciplined development team. Whether building headless components for a range of CMS, or working directly in WordPress, Drupal or Sitecore, you thrive on solving problems.

Our clients’ success is our success. And we’re incredibly ambitious. Which is why you’ll work with a crack team of strategists, UX/UI designers, managers, creatives and engineers to deliver compelling, results-driven — and at times award-winning — digital experiences for our impressive client roster.

Tasks and responsibilities:

  • Front-end web development for projects and systems that utilise a broad range of technologies such as PHP, .Net, HTML, CSS, Javascript, React, Node, Apps, APIs, CMS, web applications.
  • Carry out website maintenance and enhancements.
  • Use a combination of programming languages to develop websites based on technical scopes, as well as highly designed and documented user experiences and interfaces.
  • Write functional requirement documents and specifications.
  • Assist back-end developers with coding and troubleshooting.
  • Stay up-to-date on emerging technologies.
  • Carry out functional and usability testing, cross-device and cross-browser testing, and implement accessibility standards.
  • You may also be responsible for assisting with the agency's hosting and technical environments, performing basic system administrator tasks.

Relevant qualifications and experience:

  • IT Degree or equivalent applicable IT qualifications.
  • 6+ years of commercial experience.

Relevant skills:

  • Technologies and languages such as HTML, CSS, Javascript, React, Node, PHP, APIs, CMS, web applications and a basic working knowledge of Linux and Windows hosting environments.
  • Knowledge and experience in popular CMS, CRM, automation, EDM platforms and analytics.
  • Knowledge of version control systems (Git).
  • Experience working with multidisciplinary teams; business development, strategy, UX, design, content, marketing and development.
  • In-depth knowledge of digital design and development practices and standards.
  • Proficiency using project management tools and systems such as; Jira, GSuite and BugHerd (or similar).
  • Excellent written, presentation and oral communication skills.
  • Outstanding time management, productivity, administrative and organisational skills, particularly in a busy — and at times stressful — environment.

If you’re the right applicant, you'll take great pride in your work, realise there’s always more to learn and that positive collaboration creates the best outcomes. Fuse this with your experience and abilities, and you’ll soon find yourself having a positive impact on some of the country's, or world's, biggest brands.

If this sounds like you — connect with us.

Guerrilla is an equal opportunity employer and we encourage all applications. We are committed to hiring a diverse workforce and sustaining an inclusive work environment.

name: Full Stack Developer
description:
Who is Cloudfloat?

We are a fast-growing, VC backed, FinTech start-up based in Sydney.

Cloudfloat targets Payables and Receivables friction in the Business-to-Business Payments space. Cashflow, or lack of it, is the biggest challenges small business face and we’re working to change that. Our mission is to ‘Make Cashflow Instant’.

We believe the problem with business cashflow is rooted deeply in antiquated payment systems, archaic payment credit terms and payment processes causing businesses to incidentally act like banks and floating their customers while facing cashflow pressures themselves. Businesses are now forced to wait and hope they get paid, while buyers still need the time to make the payments.

So, we decided to build something to fix this. We are seeking specific talents to join the team.

What are we looking for?

The title means different things at different companies, for us it’s all about owning what you make of it and taking account of it.

The Customer is the core of who we are so you will work closely with new and existing Customers and with the team at large. Your entrepreneurial mindset to blaze your own trail will be an integral part of the technical success.

As a Full Stack Software Engineer you will produce scalable software solutions. You will be empowered to develop processes, systems to build and scale to solve our customer’s problems. You will be responsible for architecting and developing cloud-based solutions in an AWS environment. You will have experience in web, mobile, backend, API and database development. With automation and maintenance being at the heart of our engineering principles, this position will have the enviable opportunity to adopt and promote best practices and use new technologies and trends.

Not limited to a single product area or type, this role is cross functional. You will collaborate or build out your own cross-disciplinary team to own product software development, contribute and promote standards and engineering best practices, support operational activities such as; process automation, compliance activities, SLA upkeep requirements.

While leveraging the experiences of our Chief Technology Officer to follow the roadmap, this is a highly autonomous role.

What works for you?

*
5+ years with background in software engineering and design patterns

*
Write effective APIs

*
Familiarity with common stacks (AWS preferred)

*
Knowledge of multiple front-end languages and libraries (e.g. HTML/ CSS,

JavaScript, XML, jQuery)

*
Knowledge of multiple back-end languages (e.g. C#, Java, Python) and JavaScript

frameworks (e.g. Angular, React, Node.js)

*
Familiarity with databases (e.g. MySQL, MongoDB), web servers (e.g. Apache) and

UI/UX design

*
Work with development teams and product managers to ideate software solutions

*
Design client-side and server-side architecture

*
Develop and manage well-functioning databases and applications

*
Test software to ensure responsiveness and efficiency

*
Troubleshoot, debug and upgrade software

*
Build features and applications with a mobile responsive design

*
Experience developing desktop and mobile applications

*
Excellent communication and teamwork skills

  • Great attention to detail and Organisational skills

Note: We prioritise diversity. We seek and reward talent wherever we find it. We are trying to break the old ways of doing business in this sector, and diversity will be an important tool to achieve this.

Key attributes

*
ACTIVATE: Self-starter, eager to work in fast paced environment with levels of uncertainty

*
TRUST: Embrace and trust the company’s core mission

*
ADAPTABLE: Excels in high levels of uncertainty and change

*
FORGIVENESS: Because there is no time for asking for permission

*
FEARLESS – doesn’t recognise the word no

  • PASSION: Passionate about Customer Success

In the interest of transparency, we believe in honest, direct forms of communication and embrace 360-degree reviews.

Your reward:

Competitive Package (Salary + bonus + super)

*
Flexible working hours and working from home days

*
No limit to Annual leave, Sick leave, days off etc

Take equity in a fast-growing start-up

name: Lead Web Engineer - LoungeBuddy
description:
The Role

As a new addition to the American Express family, our team is working to develop additional ways to become an essential part of Card Members' digital lives by enabling travelers to discover, book, and access airport lounges worldwide. You will have the freedom, ownership, and speed of a startup with the backing, support, and resources of American Express.

We are growing our engineering team and are specifically looking for a teammate that can act as a peer to our existing senior engineers. Your work will be incredibly impactful as we enter our next stage of growth. As a Lead Web Developer at LoungeBuddy, you will work across our e-commerce consumer website as well as a business analytics and reporting tool for lounge operators.

Why LoungeBuddy?

We come from all around the world, spanning multiple continents. The LoungeBuddy team is made up of very unique and fascinating people. We are a small but mighty team that are passionate about working collaboratively, travel, and of course airport lounges. Our pillars are Trust & Respect, Collaboration, Learning & Growth, Ownership, and Empathy. Since our acquisition, we have kept our existing team but have gained the resources and backing of American Express to build the world's best travel experiences!

Discover more about us here: https://www.loungebuddy.com/about/team

Minimum Qualifications

Who are you?

  • You have built and maintained a high performance, scalable web application
  • You enjoy leading and mentoring junior engineers
  • You are familiar with the best practices of web security
  • You are comfortable working within an existing framework, and when no framework is provided, you are capable of building and defining your own processes
  • You have a strong work ethic and not only complete tasks, but constantly seek opportunities to hone your craft and design the best solutions possible
  • You care deeply about the quality of your work, and go the extra mile to make sure all details have been vetted, researched, and clearly communicated
  • You are committed to creating a welcoming and inclusive environment for colleagues of all backgrounds

Qualifications:

  • Deep understanding of Node.js and Web Development required
  • Experience with React.js and Angular.js
  • Solid grasp of software design patterns and why they are important
  • Ability to communicate complex software concepts to non-technical team members well and enjoy those conversations
  • Experience with automated testing
  • Enjoy shipping often and getting your hard work in front of hundreds of thousands of users regularly
  • Enjoys iterative, user-driven development that prioritizes user feedback
  • Takes an interest in the bigger picture, and how their current work fits into the team’s larger goals
  • Know how to prioritize and finding the 80/20 when necessary
  • Experience with Elastic Search
  • Experience with Localization
  • Experience with performance optimization using profiling
  • 4+ years of experience (with Node preferred)

Why American Express?

There’s a difference between having a job and making a difference.

American Express has been making a difference in people’s lives for over 160 years, backing them in moments big and small, granting access, tools, and resources to take on their biggest challenges and reap the greatest rewards.

We’ve also made a difference in the lives of our people, providing a culture of learning and collaboration, and helping them with what they need to succeed and thrive. We have their backs as they grow their skills, conquer new challenges, or even take time to spend with their family or community. And when they’re ready to take on a new career path, we’re right there with them, giving them the guidance and momentum into the best future they envision.

Because we believe that the best way to back our customers is to back our people.

The powerful backing of American Express.

Don’t make a difference without it.

Don’t live life without it.

name: Full Stack Software Engineer
description:
Come join our team of passionate people on a mission to democratise learning and be the world's largest mobile learning platform! Our goal is to enable millions of people around the world to have access to learning to upskill themselves.

Check out the story yourself!


The opportunity:

As a Full Stack Engineer at EdApp, you will have the opportunity to help build and scale our product to handle millions of users as we continue to add new features and improve our platform. Our platform handles up to 50,000 lessons every day which means you get to experience working on a truly large scale global platform.Your role is all about ownership and impact - being able to work closely with other senior developers and your team to build a robust solution for our users.

You'd be joining a growing team of 25+ engineers split between offices in Sydney and New York City, operating in small cross-functional feature teams.

Day to day responsibilities:

  • Develop and enhance our platform with a focus on our client side applications
    Write clean, clear code, that conforms to our team's standard style and effectively communicates intent to the rest of the team
    Participate in agile processes by interpreting user stories & implementing them in our platform.
  • Analyse business needs and implementation approaches to deliver high-quality applications
  • Work collaboratively with team members to complete projects on time
  • Deliver successfully on all aspects of the product life cycle stages
  • Help us collectively drive and increase our monthly active users!

The tech specs:

We have a mobile application built in React.js + redux (front end); .Netcore (C#) (back end); AWS/Kubernetes (infrastructure) and MongoDB, PostgreSQL & Snowflake (databases).

What we're looking for:

As a full stack engineer we expect you to be versatile across a range of tech:

  • ~ 5+ years of professional experience as a software engineer working across .net, ReactJS and NodeJs
  • Are comfortable in c# and JavaScript
  • Experienced in mobile application development
  • Are familiar with the cordova framework
  • Have worked on developing large scale systems with microservices knowledge being a plus
  • Experience in writing good Unit Tests and Integration Tests
  • Have agile software development experience
  • Experience with relational and NoSql databases highly preferred
  • Experience with cloud infrastructure platforms such as AWS/Azure etc a bonus
  • Exposure to Kubernetes a bonus
  • Experience with Git, Domain Driven Design and working on mobile apps are nice to haves

You will love the role if you:

  • Obsess over writing clean and clear code & you believe in strong peer review and love documentation!
  • Have a 'team first' mindset and love motivating and driving a team towards achieving deadlines and goals
  • Take pride in your work and can produce maintainable, clear solutions
  • You take initiative in order to be able to identify possible problems before they arise and identify potential solutions
  • You have the ability to communicate in a professional manner with team-mates and other areas of the business
  • Are able to work independently with limited guidance

What we can offer:

  • The opportunity to join an early stage tech company, and join us on an incredible journey
  • We're operating at a scale few other companies are, and you will have the chance to work on solving complex problems, that impact learners and users worldwide
  • Join a company with an awesome culture - we pride ourselves on our 5* rating on Glassdoor - and have a young social team - check us out on instagram @thisisedapp
  • We have a very generous employee share scheme option plan so you can really benefit from our success
  • Opportunity to work remotely once you've ramped up

Our clients already love our platform - and we hope you will too!

To apply:

We want to hear all about you. What drives you? What motivates you? What are you working on in your spare time? Please apply by providing as much detail about yourself as you think useful - and tell us why you think you'd be a great fit for EdApp!

name: Senior Front End Developer
description:
We are currently looking for a developer with a front-end focus with at least 5 years of experience to fill a full-time permanent position in a Surry Hills agency (currently WFH). The role will be mainly involved with building and maintaining websites, NodeJS servers, apps written in Cordova, and growing with the team into new technologies.

The successful candidate will work across a wide variety of websites, apps, games and clients with our multidisciplinary tech team. You must have worked in an agency environment and be able to flex across multiple skills and duties, keeping yourself motivated and organised in a friendly environment.

The right candidate will have a strong drive to improve both themselves and those around them, balancing processes and freedom to bring out the best work in themselves and the wider team. They will have developed strong ideals on development, but also are aware and capable of adjusting those ideals to fit the requirements and needs of different projects.

We are in a period of intellectual growth, having a strong drive to develop and improve our test-driven practices, deployments with continuous integration and continuous deployment, and to formalise code reviews and git best practice. We also have a desire to keep our methodologies and processes agile and appropriate for each project.

Do you like the idea of working with a team that loves games, snacks, storytelling and ideas, and who cherish everyone's quirks?

The ideal candidate will have some killer examples of their skills:

  • 5+ years writing HTML + CSS including experience using CSS preprocessors such as SASS
  • 3+ years experience writing pure Javascript and/or Typescript
  • 3+ years of the latest versions of the Angular Framework (or, if you're a React developer that could work out too!)

  • 1+ years experience writing or maintaining NodeJS servers. If you know NestJS, that's a bonus.
  • A familiarity with design software such as Photoshop, Illustrator, and Sketch, and the ability to export your own assets from design files to build with.

The candidate will be even more ideal if they optionally have:

  • Some experience building apps in the Cordova framework
  • A little PHP experience, perhaps in building Drupal or Wordpress websites
  • Some experience with deploying their own work to AWS, Heroku, Netlify or cPanel hosting sites, and administering DNS.

And finally, the candidate will be able to show off their soft skills:

  • A developed interest in test-driven development
  • The ability to match designs while also being able to add fun interactions to flat designs with minimal guidance
  • A keen eye for detail, and the ability to critically analyse their own work.
  • A Flexibility to work in a team-friendly and collaborative environment with a fun, multi-disciplinary team.
  • Strong problem-solving skills and the resilience to champion their work and ideals
  • A keen interest in security best practices, both in your code and in the security of the office environment
  • Champions our ideals: diversity, equality, and transparency

THE PROJECT FACTORY

We are a fully integrated digital studio that makes outcome-orientated, smart, story driven apps, games and websites. We are market leaders in our field and pride ourselves on being flexible and authentic. Our business is founded on strong relationships, trust, quality and innovation. We are an ambitious global business that wants to create opportunity and desire for everyone to grow personally. We believe in a working environment that is supportive, flexible and most importantly fun. Our values are important to us too and we make these central to everything we do.

name: Engineering Lead - Flomatika
description:
Elabor8

Elabor8 helps customers to become more forward-thinking and adaptive. They keep abreast of emergent ways of working and techniques, which helps our clients to achieve: Clarity (ensuring they are doing the right things); Coherence (ensuring they are doing them the right way); and, Capability (ensuring they have the skills to execute).

Flomatika

Elabor8 has leveraged it’s 10 years of experience as an agile consultancy to incubate a new SaaS platform called Flomatika to create a Service Delivery Performance and Value Stream Management platform. The Flomatika platform is a single-page React application utilising multiple AWS services. Flomatika is currently in its Early Access phase and is now looking to expand its Engineering team to take the Platform to its next level!

About The Role

We are looking for a Lead Engineer who will play a key role in the success of Flomatika’s growth and future. Initially, we expect to have a stronger technical focus, that will transition towards a Head of Engineering role as the team and platform grow. Qualities we would be interested in seeing are lifelong learners, who despite their wealth of knowledge, are pragmatic and humble. They are keen to share their knowledge and mentor others.

What we offer

  • Elabor8 offers you the chance to work in some of Australia's best technology environments, both in large corporate domains and with some of the country's most prominent online brands.
  • You'll have unlimited access to books, and learning websites like Pluralsight, Code School, and Lynda.
  • We regularly host brown bags, hackathons, and internal training sessions to make sure that our consultants are aware of leading-edge tools and techniques. We push our people to share their own knowledge and build their profiles: through presenting, mentoring, and blogging.
  • We also believe in supporting the wider community and Elabor8 sponsors events like Agile Australia, CukeUp, YOW, 1st and LAST Conference, etc.

To be considered for this role you will need

  • To have a deep understanding of the nature of Flomatika Platform and its principles to determine the best infrastructure, architecture and technology services, patterns, standards, approaches, and providers.
  • Be a hands-on engineer while mentoring other developers, helping them to grow and develop.
  • Keep up to date with the evolving technologies around software development and cloud computing.
  • Contribute to Elabor8/Flomatika Intellectual Property in the form of Blogs, Presentations, IP Harvesting, Intranet contributions, etc.
  • Attend or Facilitate IT community events such as meetups, conferences, seminars, study groups, etc.
  • Assist with company support activities, including recruitment, administration, marketing/comms, event management, community building, etc.
  • Support Client Services in the preparation of proposals and tenders for client engagements.

Technical Knowledge & Experience

  • Building Single page webapps
  • Node.js, JavaScript ES6, TypeScript, React
  • C#, Java or Ruby
  • GIT, Trunk Based Development, Feature Flags, Infrastructure as Code
  • TDD, BDD, DDD, Clean Code, Refactoring, Dependency Injection, Static Code Analysis, Consumer Driven Contracts Test
  • Event-driven architecture, Stateless design, resiliency patterns
  • GITHub, GitLab
  • CI, CD, dark launching, deployment strategies (blue-green, canary-release)
  • NoSQL modeling and development (plus for experience with DynamoDB)
  • OWASP top 10 proactive controls
  • Terraform, Serverless, Docker, Monitoring, Logging and Alerting
  • AWS Services
    • S3
    • Cloudfront
    • Lambda
    • Gateway V2
    • DynamoDB
    • SNS
    • Event Scheduling
    • Secrets Manager
    • Cloud Watch
    • EKS
    • ECR
    • WAF
    • Route53
    • Certificate Manager

Who should apply?

.Elabor8 embraces diversity and strongly encourages applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples, individuals from culturally diverse backgrounds, and with disabilities.

Please note we are hiring either in Sydney and Melbourne for this position.


WE DO NOT USE AGENCIES SO PLEASE DO NOT CONTACT US!

(Please note: that it's company policy to not revisit unsuccessful candidates within a year of your recent application. We will keep you in mind for future roles and let you know if a role turns up that would be suited to your experience and background)

name: Senior Frontend Developer
description:
Marketplacer is continuing to recruit with all interviewing and on-boarding done virtually due to COVID-19. Everyone new to the team, along with our current staff, will temporarily work from home until it is safe to return to our offices.

With over 60 marketplaces, connecting over 15,000 businesses, and with buyers across 11 countries, Marketplacer is an established leader in building online marketplaces that continues to grow every year. We are currently looking for a senior frontend developer to join our 40-member product team and help us connect the world through commerce.

Requirements

  • We believe that we succeed as a team, so you will often collaborate with other team members while working on new features or fixing bugs, including getting input from designers or project managers and pairing with other developers. We are not shy about asking for or offering help when needed. All your code changes will get reviewed by at least one developer, and our trusty, loyal SlackBot will occasionally call on you to review others’ code changes.
  • We are a rapidly growing company, constantly partnering with new businesses, which will require you to be flexible in the projects that you work on. Bugs, features, refactoring, frontend, backend, devops, projects with or without deadlines are all possible, so you’ll need to be willing to help out where needed, even if it’s unfamiliar to you.
  • We believe that we work best when we have the freedom to achieve business objectives in our own way. Managers will set priorities for the team, but it will be mostly up to you on how best to organise your tasks and time.

What we're looking for:

  • Open, friendly people who are good at collaborating with others on solving problems, who aren’t afraid to ask for help and are enthusiastic about helping others.
  • People who are passionate about new tech and ideas, who are excited about learning and experimenting.
  • People who can lead a piece of work from start to finish while taking guidance and input from the rest of the team.
  • People who are willing to work on projects outside their comfort zone, contributing to the team by working on parts of the stack or sections of the codebase that maybe they’re not as familiar with.
  • People with strong backend coding skills and familiarity with automated testing.
  • People who can help other members of the team grow in their skills.

Our tech stack:

  • Principally Ruby on Rails backend, with some services written in Python or Node.
  • React frontend written in ES6 with SASS for the styling, gradually transitioning to TypeScript with styled components.
  • GraphQL for our newer, client-facing and internal APIs.
  • AWS for cloud services and storage.
  • Docker for local dev environment and running CI/CD.
  • MySQL, Redis, and Memcached for storage.
  • ElasticSearch for site search functionality.
  • The entire ELK stack and DataDog for site monitoring.
  • Terraform and Chef/LittleChef for managing our servers

Benefits

  • We value learning, so we invest in our team to help them grow in their knowledge and skills. We have monthly hack days on which everyone can work on a project, take an online course, or contribute to open-source. We order lunch for the whole team, and at the end of the day, we present what we worked on or learned. We also have fortnightly Knowledge Showers where a team member shares their knowledge of a particular topic or system within our codebase.
  • We are all part of the tech community, both as individuals and as a company, so we’ll pay for you to go to conferences or similar events anywhere in Australia. In the past, we’ve attended RailsCamp, Ruby Conf, JS/CSS Conf, DevOpsDays, and others.
  • We enjoy exploring new ideas and technologies, and we value input from all members of the team. Many of the changes to the tools we use or how we work come from retros or self-organising working groups, so if you know of a tool or methodology that you think will help us be better, you’ll have the opportunity to make the rest of us as enthusiastic about it as you are.
  • Uncaught bugs hurt product quality and manual QA processes hurt productivity, so we have a fully-automated CI/CD pipeline that runs our comprehensive test suite and deploys to various environments with a click of the shippit button. This allows us to deploy code to production multiple times a day, confident that our changes will work as intended.
  • Because we all have lives outside of the office, we maintain flexible working arrangements. Do you have a dentist appointment? Got the sniffles? Is your child starring in the school play? In that case, you can work remotely for the day, connecting with the rest of the team via Slack or Google Meet. Right now we’re all at home every day and it’s working out well!
  • We provide various creature comforts to help you work at your best and although we are WFH at the moment, whenever we are back in the office here is a little about what we provide :
    • Large, well-furnished office, with plenty of natural light, conveniently located in South Melbourne, just a few minutes from the 109 tram stop.
    • The laptop of your choice (MacBook, Dell XPS, etc.) and any software you may need.
    • Moccamaster coffee maker, supplied with the finest ground coffee from local roasters (we’re also close to a few cafes if that’s what you prefer).
    • Twice-weekly fruit delivery: not a single member of our team has had scurvy in the history of Marketplacer.
    • A Nintendo Switch that facilitates regular Mario Kart competitions.
    • Dogs are welcome in the office too
    • A table-tennis table (in its own room, closed off from the rest of the office) on which we occasionally hold tournaments.
    At Marketplacer, we know the value of working with people with different skills, backgrounds, and experiences, and we believe in promoting a diverse and inclusive team that is great to work with for all sorts of people. So, we strongly encourage anyone from underrepresented groups in tech to apply for this position.

name: Backend Developer
description:
Senior Backend Developer

*SUMMARY
GOFAR is looking for a Senior Backend Developer to manage and strengthen our back end API and infrastructure. The back end supports thousands of drivers across the world to log their trips, export their data as mileage reports and manage their car’s health and costs. Most of our data, AI and machine learning functions are built through the back end so this is a cutting edge role.
The Company
GOFAR is in the fast growing Smart Mobility space and makes a multi-award winning connected car (IoT) device. We focus on Australia but have already won thousands of customers in 73 countries.

Our products are proven and very highly regarded with 80% of reviews being 5 star.

Drivers buy our products to log trips and save time and money but we also deliver a strong social purpose too by significantly cutting car crashes and emissions.

We’re now looking for a talented, action-oriented Senior Backend Developer to help us reliably roll out a suite of exciting new products. This is a well established and funded start-up.
The Position
Based in the Sydney CBD office, but with the option to work remotely you’ll be working directly alongside the founder and within a small, high performing engineering comprising another back end engineer, mobile developers and hardware and electrical engineers.
*
*
You’ll assume responsibility for

  • Maintaining the back end ensuring our systems run reliably as we scale
  • Helping to develop new features
  • Creating new reports and being the lead engineer for our extensive data management requirements

*
*
The stack you’ll be working with is:

  • Node JS REST API written using loopback js deployed to AWS as an ECS (Fargate) app
  • All new infrastructure built as typescript / python lambda functions, buffered by SQS
  • Infrastructure-as-Code using AWS CDK
  • Most data stored in RDS (Postgres) with data warehouse in S3/Athena
  • Machine learning layer using sklearn + XGBoost deployed on lambda
  • Nascent web dashboard written in Next JS with a GraphQL API layer

*
*
Broader stack at the company:

  • Native android app written in Kotlin/Java
  • Native iOS app written in Swift/Objective C
  • In house designed, custom IoT hardware (OBD2 adapter) with firmware written in C

*
*Skills and Requirements:

  • 5+ years experience with Node JS
  • 5+ years working with Postgres including experience with PG12 table partitioning
  • 3+ years working with AWS

*
*
Nice to have skills

  • Team lead experience (or ready to start leading teams)
  • Experience with building + managing a data warehouse
  • Python + ML Experience
  • React JS + GraphQL Experience
  • Experience building APIs for Android / iOS so you can work well with front end developers
  • Experience working in scrum / sprint environment
  • Automotive industry experience or experience tinkering with hardware (like OBD2 dongles or Raspberry Pi) a definite asset.

*
*The Benefits:

  • Be part of a small, dedicated team that’s built a great product that customers love - and be a part of taking it global.
  • The opportunity to take on as much responsibility as you can handle
  • Great salary package plus super plus share options negotiable
  • Flexible hours possible and can even be part time for right candidate
  • Central Sydney CBD location or work from home

To Apply:
If this sounds like the ideal role for you, send your CV and a short email

name: Graduate Software Engineer
description:
Freelancer Limited, the ASX-listed company that owns Freelancer.com and Escrow.com, is hiring. Twelve-time Webby award-winning Freelancer.com is the world's largest freelancing and crowdsourcing marketplace, which connects millions of employers to freelancers across the globe. Escrow.com is a global fintech industry leader in secure online payments, having handled over US$4.5 billion in transactions buying and selling boats, cars, airplanes, jewellery, fine art, and even trips to the planned Aurora space station in 2021!

We think it is pretty cool that our marketplace hosts a real life economy, where work is undertaken in every area you can think of. From design, writing, data entry and software development; through to sales, marketing, accounting and legal services - even NASA uses us!

We are looking for graduate software engineers to join our team! We work with the latest tech, and push code 30-40 times a day in a high-performance cloud environment. We develop core, revenue-generating products, and so this represents an opportunity to have a fundamental impact on our global business.

Not only will you build features and software that scale, but your work will have direct impact on tens of millions of users worldwide. So if you excel at architecting web applications at scale, enjoy the challenge of writing optimised lightning fast SQL for massive data sets, have experience structuring extensible data and application logic, and are passionate about designing high quality APIs, then we'd love to hear from you!

Requirements

  • Tertiary Degree in Computer Science / Engineering (or related)
  • Australian/New Zealand citizenship / Permanent Resident Only

Must haves:

  • Proficiency in one or two web development languages, such as Python, Golang, PHP, Node.js or Ruby
  • Experience with relational databases and SQL, preferably MySQL
  • Interest in web engineering at scale
  • Linux experience
  • Cloud computing experience, preferably AWS
  • Strong writing and verbal communication skills
  • Strong sense of ownership and able to self-manage work
  • Self-motivated and keen on learning new technologies
  • Strong troubleshooting skills and creative problem-solving ability

Nice-to-haves:

  • Experience with modern Javascript framework, such as Angular, React or Vue
  • Experience with TypeScript
  • Experience with SOA, microservice and containerisation architecture
  • Experience with development of public facing APIs
  • Strong knowledge of computer networking
  • Sound understanding of OWASP and the best web security practices

We would love you to have:

  • Strong academic achievements (Please attach your academic records with your application)
  • MS or PhD degrees
  • A Github page with contributions to open source software

Benefits

This won’t be a cog-in-the-machine type of job; you will be joining a global company that values attitude and capability over experience, so if you are looking to make a difference and be rewarded for your efforts, this is the place for you.

We are striving to shape the future of work, so help us scale to 100+ million users, while enjoying all the perks of working in tech - fun atmosphere, smart people, awesome office, fully-stocked kitchens (yes, free food!), social events, hackathons, and more!
