name: Head of Engineering
description:
Why Brighte?

Brighte is Australia’s leading point of sale finance platform for solar, batteries & home improvements.

We’re recognised as one of Australia’s leading fintech companies, having been ranked the 2nd fastest growing Technology Business in Australia (and 4th fastest in APAC) in the Deloitte Fast 50/500 (2019) and winning the inaugural Finder Green Award (2020).

We’re a high performing team that is backed by Airtree Ventures, Mike Cannon-Brookes’ Grok Investments, Kim Jackson and Scott Farquhar’s Skip Capital as well as Qualgro Partners. We’re also recognised as a leading FinTech by the Australian Financial Review, Fintech Business Awards and KPMG & H2 Ventures in their Fintech 100 list.

We continue to expand into exciting new products and channels that support vendors and their customers in the energy & home improvement industries, and we have only just started on what we want to achieve.

We’re customer centric, innovative, accountable and inclusive, with a passion to make a difference.


What will you do

In this newly created role reporting directly to the CTO, the Head of Engineering will oversee the strategy and people leadership of the Engineering team. You will be responsible for current business needs as well as the future engineering technology and delivery roadmap.
Leading a growing team of engineers, you will be an extremely strong software engineering leader whose able to understand architecture, create solutions and have scalability in mind. You will also:
  • Provide the inspiration and vision to drive a strong engineering function at Brighte, manage and grow the team as well as build a strong high performing engineering culture
  • Oversee and drive innovation in development tools, coding languages and coding principles. Ability to drive transformation to a full stack engineering function.
  • Work closely with the Delivery and IT Operations leaders on the development and deployment of the Tech strategy, delivery roadmap and technology OKRs
  • Drive agile work practices across software engineering and oversee the development of new software and web applications
  • Collaborate with other teams and leaders across Brighte to evaluate and identify technology platforms for delivering the company’s products and internal services

What we are looking for
  • Proven people leadership and coaching experience of teams of approximately 20 people
  • Ability to influence and lead stakeholders across different functions
  • Set a strategy and a delivery roadmap for the Engineering function
  • Pragmatic and analytical - able to understand, integrate and assess information relating to technological issues and opportunities within a complex and multifaceted environment
  • Ability to confidently build effective partnerships with key senior stakeholders and negotiate and influence to achieve key objectives
  • Knowledgeable of emerging technology trends, and have rich expertise in Software Engineering
  • Experience with full stack software engineering practices and the ability to transform engineering teams to take advantage of full stack
  • Knowledge of AWS, PHP, React, Node.js preferable

More reasons to work for us- Brighte Perks

  • Competitive salary and opportunity to participate in our Employee Share Option Plan- we want to build a successful company and success means creating and sharing this value together
  • Awesome team culture
  • We offer flexible working options to support the Whole You
  • Competitive Parental (including secondary) leave policy
  • An inclusive workplace where we celebrate diversity
  • Access to our Employee Assistance Program, which includes 6 sessions for financial, work, relationship, or wellbeing support

name: Software Engineer - Full Stack
description:
Learnosity’s mission is to power better student outcomes in every learning product in the world, through technology. We are geeks at heart and we love what we do. We’re looking for talented people to join our growing teams.

At Learnosity, we have built a cloud-based API toolkit to help educators build learning platforms that make a positive difference to how students learn. We believe that education is the most important investment we can make for our future and aim to empower all educational companies with our API toolkit.

We have been growing steadily for over 10 years; we already power some of the world’s leading learning platforms and publishers, and in September 2020 alone we had 20.9 million students taking assessments through our platform.

We are looking for a Software Engineer, with solid Full Stack experience, to join our teams. This is a full-time role where you’ll be working with a diverse team in a great office based in Sydney's CBD. Work will be based remotely whilst restrictions are in place and permanent remote work is a possibility for the right candidate.


If successful you will:

  • Work with, learn from, and contribute to a diverse, collaborative development team
  • Use plenty of JavaScript, CSS, PHP, MySQL, PostgreSQL, AWS Services and other technologies
  • Build efficient and reusable abstractions and systems
  • Create robust cloud-based systems used by students globally at scale
  • Experiment with cutting edge technologies and contribute to the company’s product roadmap
  • Deliver data at scale to bring value to clients

Requirements

You will need:

  • Sound knowledge of JavaScript, HTML, CSS
  • Experience in any of these areas: ReactJS, Vue.js, Backbone, Webpack, NodeJS, Symfony
  • Experience working with a server side language in a full-stack environment
  • Great knowledge of design patterns and front end architecture best practices
  • Experience with TDD, automated testing
  • 5+ years experience as a developer
  • Experience with Git or Mercurial
  • Fluent written & spoken English


It would be great if you have:

  • B.Sc or M.Sc degree in Software Engineering, Computer Science or similar
  • Experience and/or interest in API Design
  • Experience with Backbone.js and/or React
  • Experience with various database technologies (relational, nosql, document-oriented, etc) and query concepts in high performance environments
  • Experience with Docker
  • Contributed to open source projects
  • Experience working in an Agile environment

Benefits

We are a values-based company, and our 4 core values are the basis for how we work and what we do every day. Being a part of the Learnosity team means that you’ll get to join us in living out these values:

  • We live to learn
  • We aim higher
  • We do the right thing
  • Our success is better shared

Personal Development: Our team is on the cutting edge of technology and we want it to stay there. We encourage staff to get involved in individual advancement and professional certification programs. You will have your own learning and development budget and we will sponsor certification exams where appropriate.

Flexibility: We are keen to help you maximise the value of your time by allowing you to design a schedule around your preferred working style. We’ll do our best to meet your needs, whether you need to accommodate children, avoid busy commute periods, or attend a gym or sports club. Learnosity also offers above-and-beyond parental leave and we work with our employees to ensure a successful return to work following parental leave.

Community: Working together is key to our shared success, so creating a respectful and inclusive work environment for everyone is a top priority. We enjoy a community culture that covers a broad range of interests and we make sure to organise regular team activities and celebrations of our major accomplishments to recognise everyone’s hard work.


Learnosity's benefits package includes:

  • Your own Annual Learning Budget
  • Flexible work practices
  • Agile work environment
  • Generous paid parental leave
  • Team social budgets
  • Ample time for slack (games, sports teams, etc)

Learnosity is committed to ensuring equal employment opportunity to all qualified individuals. We believe a diverse workforce will enhance our ability to fulfil our mission of advancing education and ed-tech in general.

Find out more about your career at Learnosity at learnosity.com/careers/

Please see our Recruitment Privacy Policy

About the Role

We’re looking to grow the team with the hire of 2 x Senior Full Stack Developers, to support the extension of our automation platform to cover new and exciting use cases. Successful applicants will be joining a project to extend the platform to handle the creation of new cloud accounts and deployment of customer landing zones.

We are looking for a Senior Developer who can:

  • Is able to support customers directly

From a technical standpoint, we need developers that can:

  • Write code fluently in JavaScript (ideally ecmascript2015+)

Frontend: React, Redux

We are now part of a much larger entity and this has given us a great opportunity to grow out our team and further improve upon our product offerings. There has never been a better time to join!

If this role sounds of interest, please apply via our exclusive recruitment partner: White Bay via the apply now button and we look forward to reading your resume.

The ideal candidates will be NSW based within 90 minutes commute to Sydney CBD for the occasional need for the team to come together, otherwise, these roles are entirely home-based.
